original: IAII' Ms / / Sh / / W /' / P / / D / / N / / Co / / Ch /

translated: or an evil reputation, fame, and bad words may arise for me in all directions.

original: sa ebhyo dṛṣṭadharmasāṃparāyikebhyas taddhetukebhyo 'niṣṭebhyo dharmebhyo bhayadarśī bhavati /
analyzed: saḥ ebhyaḥ dṛṣṭadharma sāṃparāyikebhyaḥ tad hetukebhyaḥ niṣṭebhyaḥ dharmebhyaḥ bhaya darśī bhavati
translated: One sees fear in those undesirable things that are the causes of those things in this life and the next.

original: yena tāni kṣudrāṇukṣudrāṇi śikṣāpadāni jīvitahetor api na saṃcintyādhyāpadyate /
analyzed: yena tāni kṣudra aṇu kṣudrāṇi śikṣā padāni jīvita hetoḥ api na saṃcintya adhyāpadyate
translated: By which, even for the sake of life, one does not intentionally commit those minor training precepts.

original: kadācit karhicit smṛtisaṃpramoṣād adhyāpanno laghu laghv eva yathādharmaṃ pratikaroti vyuttiṣṭhate /
analyzed: kadācid karhicit smṛti saṃpramoṣāt adhyāpannaḥ laghu laghu eva yathādharmam pratikaroti vyuttiṣṭhate
translated: Sometimes, due to a lapse of mindfulness, one commits an offense, but quickly, quickly, one makes amends according to the Dharma and rises up [from the offense].

analyzed: evam aṇu mātreṣu avadyeṣu bhaya darśī bhavati
translated: Thus one sees fear in even the slightest faults.

analyzed: katham samādāya śikṣate śikṣā padeṣu
translated: How does one undertake and train in the precepts?

analyzed: āha
translated: He says:

original: pūrvam anena prātimokṣasaṃvarasamādāne jñapticaturthena karmaṇopasaṃpadyamānena katipayānāṃ śikṣāpadānāṃ śarīraṃ śrutaṃ /
analyzed: pūrvam anena prātimokṣa saṃvara samādāne jñapti caturthena karmaṇā upasaṃpadyamānena katipayānām śikṣā padānām śarīram śrutam
translated: Previously, when he was being fully admitted through the fourth action with proclamation in taking up the Prātimokṣa restraint, he heard the body of a few precepts.

original: sātirekaṃ ca tadanyam ardhatṛtīyaṃ śikṣāpadaśataṃ prātimokṣasūtroddiṣṭaṃ pratijñayaivopagataṃ sarvatra śikṣiṣyāmīti /
analyzed: sa atirekam ca tad anyam ardhatṛtīyam śikṣā pada śatam prātimokṣa sūtra uddiṣṭam pratijñayā eva upagatam sarvatra śikṣiṣyāmi iti
translated: And the other more than half of the three and a half hundred precepts taught in the Prātimokṣa Sūtra, he undertook by vow, thinking I will train everywhere.

analyzed: ācārya upādhyāyānām antikāt śrutvā
translated: Having heard from his teachers and preceptors,

analyzed: ālaptaka saṃlaptaka saṃstutaka sapriyakānām
translated: those who talk, those who associate, those who are intimate, and those who are dear,

analyzed: ardha ardha māsam ca prātimokṣa sūtra uddeśataḥ
translated: and every half month from the recitation of the Prātimokṣa Sūtra,

original: tataś ca tena sarvaśikṣāpadasamādānāt prātimokṣasaṃvaraḥ pratilabdhaḥ /
analyzed: tatas ca tena sarva śikṣā pada samādānāt prātimokṣa saṃvaraḥ pratilabdhaḥ
translated: and then, because he undertook all the precepts, he obtained the Prātimokṣa restraint.

original: tata uttarakālaṃ yeṣu śikṣāpadeṣu kuśalo bhavati tāni tāvan nādhyāpadyate /
analyzed: tatas uttara kālam yeṣu śikṣā padeṣu kuśalaḥ bhavati tāni tāvat na adhyāpadyate
translated: After that, in the precepts in which he is skilled, he does not transgress them for the time being.

original: adhyāpannaś ca yathādharmaṃ pratikaroti /🔽yeṣu punaḥ Śbh I
analyzed: adhyāpannaḥ ca yathādharmam pratikaroti  yeṣu punar śbh i
translated: And when he has transgressed, he makes amends according to the Dharma.

analyzed: śikṣā padeṣu akuśalaḥ bhavati
translated: But in those precepts in which he is not skilled,🔽he does not transgress them for the time being.

original: avyutpannabuddhiḥ tāni pūrvaṃ pratijñāsamādānena samādattāny etarhi vyutpattikauśalyatayā samādadāti /
analyzed: avyutpanna buddhiḥ tāni pūrvam pratijñā samādānena samādattāni etarhi vyutpatti kauśalya tayā samādadāti
translated: He who has not yet understood the teachings, having previously undertaken them through a promise, now undertakes them through skill in understanding.

original: tebhyaḥ pūrvaṃ yathāparikīrtitebhyaḥ sthānebhya ācāryasya vopādhyāyasya vā pūrvavat /
analyzed: tebhyaḥ pūrvam yathā parikīrtitebhyaḥ sthānebhyaḥ ācāryasya vā upādhyāyasya vā pūrvavat
translated: From those same previously mentioned sources, from the teacher or preceptor, as before.

analyzed: vyutpatti kauśalya tayā ca punar samādāya
translated: And having undertaken them through skill in understanding,

original: yathānuśiṣṭo 'nyūnam anadhikaṃ śikṣate teṣu gurugurusthānīyavyapadiṣṭeṣu śikṣāpadeṣu /
analyzed: yathā anuśiṣṭaḥ nyūnam anadhikam śikṣate teṣu guru guru sthānīya vyapadiṣṭeṣu śikṣā padeṣu
translated: he trains in those precepts taught by the teacher or preceptor, neither less nor more than taught.

original: aviparītagrāhī ca bhavaty arthasya vyañjanasya ca /
analyzed: a viparīta grāhī ca bhavati arthasya vyañjanasya ca
translated: And he grasps the meaning and the words without error.

analyzed: evam samādāya śikṣate śikṣā padeṣu ayam
translated: Thus, having undertaken, he trains in the precepts.

analyzed: tāvat vibhaṃgaḥ śīla saṃvarasya vistara kṛtaḥ
translated: This is the detailed explanation of the restraint of morality.

analyzed: tatra katamaḥ samāsa arthaḥ
translated: Now, what is its concise meaning?

original: tatrāyaṃ samāsārthas trilakṣaṇa eva śīlaskandhaḥ paridīpito bhagavatā /
analyzed: tatra ayam samāsa arthaḥ tri lakṣaṇaḥ eva śīla skandhaḥ paridīpitaḥ bhagavatā
translated: This concise meaning is explained by the Blessed One as having three characteristics of the aggregate of morality.

analyzed: tat yathā vipraṇāśa lakṣaṇaḥ  svabhāva lakṣaṇaḥ
translated: Namely, the characteristic of non-loss,🔽the characteristic of intrinsic nature,

analyzed: svabhāva guṇa lakṣaṇaḥ ca
translated: and the characteristic of the intrinsic nature of qualities.

original: yathā katham iti yat tāvad āha śīlavān viharatīty anena tāvad avipraṇāśalakṣaṇaṃ śīlasaṃvarasyākhyātam //
analyzed: yathā katham iti yat tāvat āha śīlavān viharati iti anena tāvat a vipraṇāśa lakṣaṇam śīla saṃvarasya ākhyātam
translated: As to how [he practices], first, by saying he lives with virtue, he has explained the characteristic of non-transgression of the virtue restraint.

original: yat punar āha prātimokṣasaṃvarasaṃvṛta ity anena svabhāvalakṣaṇam ākhyātam //
analyzed: yat punar āha prātimokṣa saṃvara saṃvṛtaḥ iti anena svabhāva lakṣaṇam ākhyātam
translated: Moreover, by saying bound by the Prātimokṣa restraint, he has explained the characteristic of the intrinsic nature.

analyzed: iv u vi
translated: IV. V. VI.

analyzed: yat punar āha
translated: Moreover, he says:

analyzed: ācāra gocara saṃpannaḥ iti
translated: Endowed with proper conduct and resort.

original: anena param upanidhāya tathā samādattasya prātimokṣasaṃvarasya guṇalakṣaṇam ākhyātam //
analyzed: anena param upanidhāya tathā samādattasya prātimokṣa saṃvarasya guṇa lakṣaṇam ākhyātam
translated: By this, he has explained the characteristic of the virtue of the Prātimokṣa restraint that is undertaken in that way, in relation to others.

original: tathāpi pare tām ācāragocarasaṃpadam upalabhyāprasannāś ca prasīdanti /
analyzed: tathā api pare tām ācāra gocara saṃpadam upalabhya aprasannāḥ ca prasīdanti
translated: However, even if others, upon observing that proper conduct and resort, become faithful,

analyzed: prasannānām ca bhavati bhūyobhāvaḥ
translated: and for the faithful, there is an increase,

analyzed: prasannāḥ ca prasanna adhikāram kurvanti
translated: and the faithful perform acts of faith,

analyzed: na ca manāṃsi pradūṣayanti
translated: and they do not disturb the mind,

analyzed: na avarṇam niścārayanti
translated: and they do not utter dispraise,

original: anyathā śīlasaṃpannasyācāragocarasaṃpannasyāyaṃ parādhipateyo guṇa ānuśaṃsā na bhavet / Śbh I
analyzed: anyathā śīla saṃpannasya ācāra gocara saṃpannasya ayam para ādhipateyaḥ guṇaḥ ānuśaṃsā na bhavet
translated: otherwise, for one endowed with virtue, endowed with proper conduct and resort, this quality and benefit would not be dependent on others.

analyzed: etad viparyayeṇa vā asya doṣaḥ eva bhavet
translated: On the contrary, for him, it would be a fault.

analyzed: yat punar āha
translated: Moreover, he says:

original: aṇumātreṣv avadyeṣu bhayadarśī samādāya śikṣate śīkṣāpadeṣv iti /
analyzed: aṇu mātreṣu avadyeṣu bhaya darśī samādāya śikṣate śīkṣā padeṣu iti
translated: Seeing danger even in what is very slight, one undertakes and trains in the precepts,

analyzed: anena adhyātma ādhipateya guṇa anuśaṃsa lakṣaṇam ākhyātam
translated: By this, the characteristic of the benefit of the qualities that are one's own master is stated.

analyzed: tat kasya hetoḥ
translated: Why is that?

original: yad apy evam ācāragocarasaṃpannaḥ parādhipateyaṃ guṇānuśaṃsaṃ pratilabheta /
analyzed: yat api evam ācāra gocara saṃpannaḥ para ādhipateyam guṇa anuśaṃsam pratilabheta
translated: Even if one who is endowed with proper conduct and practice obtains the benefit of the qualities that are another's master,

original: api tu śīlaṃ vipādayitvā taddhetos tatpratyayam apāyeṣūpapadyate /
analyzed: api tu śīlam vipādayitvā tad hetoḥ tad pratyayam apāyeṣu upapadyate
translated: nevertheless, having violated morality, for that reason and on that account, one is reborn in the lower realms.

analyzed: a bhavya tām vā a prāptasya prāptaye pūrvavat
translated: Or one becomes incapable of attaining what has not been attained, as before.

original: yat punar aṇumātreṣv avadyeṣu bhayadarśī bhavati /
analyzed: yat punar aṇu mātreṣu avadyeṣu bhaya darśī bhavati
translated: But when one sees danger even in what is very slight,

original: prāg evādhimātreṣu samādāya ca śikṣate śikṣāpadeṣu tasmāt taddhetos tatpratyayaṃ kāyasya bhedāt sugatāv upapadyate /
analyzed: prāk eva adhimātreṣu samādāya ca śikṣate śikṣā padeṣu tasmāt tad hetoḥ tad pratyayam kāyasya bhedāt sugatau upapadyate
translated: and having undertaken, trains in the precepts, for that reason and on that account, at the dissolution of the body, one is reborn in a good destination.

original: bhavyo vā bhavaty aprāptasya prāptaye pūrvavad /
analyzed: bhavyaḥ vā bhavati a prāptasya prāptaye pūrvavat
translated: Or one becomes capable of attaining what has not been attained, as before.

original: anena kāraṇenādhyātmādhipateyo 'yaṃ śīlasaṃvarasya guṇānuśaṃsa ity ucyate //
analyzed: anena kāraṇena adhyātma ādhipateyaḥ yam śīla saṃvarasya guṇa anuśaṃsaḥ iti ucyate
translated: For this reason, this is said to be the benefit of the qualities of the morality restraint that is one's own master.

analyzed: aparaḥ punar paryāyaḥ
translated: There is another explanation:

analyzed: samāsatas bhagavatā samādatta śīla tā paridīpitā
translated: In brief, the Blessed One has illuminated the morality that is undertaken.

analyzed: nairyāṇika śīla tā ca
translated: And the morality that leads to liberation.

analyzed: śīla bhāvanā ca
translated: And the cultivation of morality.

analyzed: tatra yat tāvat āha
translated: Here, first of all, he said:

analyzed: śīlavān viharati iti anena samādatta śīla tā ākhyātā
translated: He dwells with morality - by this, the morality of undertaking is shown.

original: yat punar āha /🔽prātimokṣasaṃvarasaṃvṛta ity anena nairyāṇikaśīlatākhyātā /
analyzed: yat punar āha  prātimokṣa saṃvara saṃvṛtaḥ iti anena nairyāṇika śīla tā ākhyātā
translated: And again, he said:🔽He is restrained by the restraint of the Prātimokṣa - by this, the morality that leads to liberation is shown.

original: tathā hi prātimokṣasaṃvarasaṃgṛhītaṃ śīlam adhiśīlaṃ śikṣety ucyate /
analyzed: tathā hi prātimokṣa saṃvara saṃgṛhītam śīlam adhiśīlam śikṣā iti ucyate
translated: For the morality included in the restraint of the Prātimokṣa is called the training in higher morality.

analyzed: adhiśīlam ca śikṣām niśritya  adhicittam ca
translated: And relying on the training in higher morality,🔽and on the training in higher mind,

analyzed: adhiprajñam ca sikṣām bhāvayati
translated: and on the training in higher wisdom,

analyzed: evam asau sarva duḥkha kṣayāya niryātaḥ bhavati
translated: in this way he goes forth to the destruction of all suffering.

original: yadutādhiśīlaṃ pratiṣṭhāya pūrvaṃgamaṃ kṛtvā tasmāt prātimokṣasaṃvaro nairyāṇikaṃ śīlam ity ucyate //
analyzed: yat uta adhi śīlam pratiṣṭhāya pūrvaṃgamam kṛtvā tasmāt prātimokṣa saṃvaraḥ nairyāṇikam śīlam iti ucyate
translated: That is, relying on the training in higher morality, making it the forerunner, therefore the restraint of the Prātimokṣa is called the morality that leads to liberation.

analyzed: yat punar āha
translated: And again, he said:

original: ācāragocarasaṃpanno 'ṇumātreṣv avadyeṣu bhayadarśī samādāya śikṣate śikṣāpadeṣv ity anena śīlabhāvanākhyātā /
analyzed: ācāra gocara saṃpannaḥ ṇu mātreṣu avadyeṣu bhaya darśī samādāya śikṣate śikṣā padeṣu iti anena śīla bhāvanā ākhyātā
translated: Endowed with good conduct and sphere of activity, seeing danger in the slightest fault, he undertakes and trains in the precepts - by this, the cultivation of morality is shown.

analyzed: ebhiḥ ākāraiḥ tat prātimokṣa saṃvara śīlam bhāvayitavyam
translated: By these aspects, that morality of restraint of the Prātimokṣa should be cultivated.

original: evaṃ ca bhāvitaṃ subhāvitaṃ Śbh I bhavatīti /
analyzed: evam ca bhāvitam su bhāvitam śbh i bhavati iti
translated: And thus it is well cultivated when cultivated.

original: sa eṣa ekaḥ śīlasaṃvaraḥ ṣaḍākāradeśanāpratyupasthāno veditavyaḥ //
analyzed: saḥ eṣaḥ ekaḥ śīla saṃvaraḥ ṣaṣ ākāra deśanā pratyupasthānaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: This one restraint of morality should be known as being present through six kinds of teaching.

original: sa khalu eṣa śīlasaṃvaro daśabhiḥ kāraṇair vipanno veditavyaḥ /
analyzed: sa khalu eṣa śīla saṃvaraḥ daśabhiḥ kāraṇaiḥ vipannaḥ veditavyaḥ
translated: That restraint of morality, moreover, should be known as ruined by ten causes.

analyzed: viparyayāt daśabhiḥ ca eva kāraṇaiḥ saṃpannaḥ
translated: And by the opposite, it is complete by ten causes.

analyzed: katamaiḥ daśabhiḥ kāraṇaiḥ vipannaḥ bhavati
translated: By which ten causes is it ruined?

analyzed: āditas eva durgṛhītaḥ bhavati  ati līnaḥ bhavati
translated: From the very beginning, it is badly grasped.🔽It is too low.

analyzed: atisṛtaḥ bhavati  pramāda kausīdya parigṛhītaḥ bhavati
translated: It is too high.🔽It is embraced by heedlessness and laziness.

analyzed: mithyā praṇihitaḥ bhavati  ācāra vipattyā parigṛhītaḥ bhavati
translated: It is wrongly directed.🔽It is embraced by the failure of conduct.

analyzed: ājīva vipattyā parigṛhītaḥ bhavati
translated: It is embraced by the failure of livelihood.

analyzed: anta dvaya patitaḥ bhavati  a nairyāṇikaḥ bhavati
translated: It falls into the two extremes.🔽It is not leading to emancipation.

analyzed: samādāna paribhraṣṭaḥ ca bhavati
translated: And it is fallen away from the undertaking.

original: tatra katham ādito durgṛhītaṃ śīlaṃ bhavati /🔽yathāpīhaikatyo rājābhinirṇīto vā pravrajitaś /🔽caurābhinirṇīto vā /
analyzed: tatra katham āditas durgṛhītam śīlam bhavati  yathā api iha ekatyaḥ rājā abhinirṇītaḥ vā pravrajitaḥ  caura abhinirṇītaḥ vā
translated: There, how is morality badly grasped from the beginning?🔽As follows: Here someone goes forth out of fear of a king or a robber.

analyzed: ṛṇa ārtaḥ vā  bhaya ārtaḥ vā
translated: Or out of fear of a king or a robber.🔽Or out of fear of debt.🔽Or out of fear of punishment.

analyzed: ajīvikā bhaya bhītaḥ vā
translated: Or out of fear of lack of livelihood.

analyzed: na śrāmaṇyāya
translated: Not for the purpose of asceticism.

analyzed: na brāhmaṇyāya  na ātma śamāya  na ātma damāya
translated: Not for the purpose of brahminhood.🔽Not for the purpose of self-pacification.🔽Not for the purpose of self-control.

analyzed: na ātma parinirvāṇāya
translated: Not for the purpose of self-extinction.

analyzed: evam āditas durgṛhītaḥ bhavati
translated: Thus it is wrongly grasped from the beginning.

analyzed: katham ati līnaḥ bhavati
translated: How is it too low?

analyzed: yathā api iha ekatyaḥ lajjī bhavati manda kaukṛtyaḥ
translated: It is like this: here someone is shameless, has little remorse,

analyzed: śaithilikaḥ śithila kārī śikṣā padeṣu
translated: is lax, and acts laxly in the precepts.

analyzed: evam ati līnaḥ bhavati
translated: Thus it is too low.

analyzed: katham atisṛtaḥ bhavati
translated: How is it too loose?

analyzed: yathā api iha ekatyaḥ durgṛhīta grāhī bhavati asthāna kaukṛtyaḥ
translated: It is like this: here someone grasps wrongly, has remorse in inappropriate places,

analyzed: saukṛtya karaṇīyeṣu sthāneṣu kaukṛtyāyamānaḥ
translated: having remorse in places where one should have remorse.

original: asthāne pareṣām antike paribhavacittaṃ vāghātaṃ votpādayati pravedayati /
analyzed: asthāne pareṣām antike paribhava cittam vā āghātam vā utpādayati pravedayati
translated: In inappropriate places, he arouses and expresses a mind of contempt or hostility towards others.

analyzed: evam atisṛtam bhavati  śbh i
translated: Thus it is too loose.🔽Here is the Sanskrit-English alignment based on the Japanese translations:

analyzed: caḥ
translated: Here is the corrected and aligned text:

analyzed: katham pramāda kausīdya parigṛhītam bhavati
translated: How is it taken up by negligence and laziness?

original: yathāpīhaikatyo yām atītam adhvānam upādāyāpattim āpannaḥ /
analyzed: yathā api iha ekatyaḥ yām atītam adhvānam upādāya āpattim āpannaḥ
translated: It is like this: here someone, having taken up the past time, has fallen into an offense,

original: sā cānena smṛtisaṃpramoṣād ekatyā na yathādharmaṃ pratikṛtā bhavati /
analyzed: sā ca anena smṛti saṃpramoṣāt ekatyā na yathādharmam pratikṛtā bhavati
translated: and that, by him, through the loss of mindfulness, some is not made right according to the Dharma.

analyzed: yathā atītam adhvānam upādāya
translated: As in the past time,

original: evam anāgataṃ vartamānam adhvānam upādāya yām āpattim āpanno bhavati /
analyzed: evam anāgatam vartamānam adhvānam upādāya yām āpattim āpannaḥ bhavati
translated: In the same way, he commits an offense in the present time, based on the future time.

original: sā cānena smṛtisaṃpramoṣād ekatyā na yathādharmaṃ pratikṛtā bhavati /
analyzed: sā ca anena smṛti saṃpramoṣāt ekatyā na yathādharmam pratikṛtā bhavati
translated: And because of a lapse of mindfulness, he does not make amends for some of those offenses in accordance with the Dharma.

original: na ca pūrvam evāpatter āyatyām anadhyāpattaye tīvram autsukyam āpadyate /
analyzed: na ca pūrvam eva āpatteḥ āyatyām anadhyāpattaye tīvram autsukyam āpadyate
translated: And before the offense, he does not make a strong effort to avoid committing it in the future.

original: yan nv ahaṃ tathā tathā careyaṃ vihareyam /
analyzed: yat nu aham tathā tathā careyam vihareyam
translated: What if I were to act and behave in such a way that,

translated: while acting and behaving in that way, I would not commit an offense?

original: tathā ca tathā carati viharati yathāpattim adhyāpadyate /
analyzed: tathā ca tathā carati viharati yathā āpattim adhyāpadyate
translated: And he acts and behaves in such a way that he does commit an offense.

original: so 'nena pūrvāntasahagatenāparāntasahagatena madhyāntasahagatena pūrvakālakaraṇīyena sahānucareṇa ca pramādena samanvāgataḥ nidrāsukhaṃ śayanasukhaṃ
analyzed: saḥ nena pūrva anta sahagatena apara anta sahagatena madhya anta sahagatena pūrva kāla karaṇīyena saha anucareṇa ca pramādena samanvāgataḥ nidrā sukham śayana sukham
translated: He is endowed with that heedlessness that is connected with the past, the future, and the present, and that is connected with what should be done before and after, and that accompanies it. He accepts the pleasure of sleep, the pleasure of lying down,

analyzed: pārśva sukham ca svīkaroti
translated: and the pleasure of lying on his side.

analyzed: a dakṣaḥ ca bhavati alasaḥ
translated: And he is not skillful, not diligent,

analyzed: an utthāna saṃpannaḥ
translated: not endowed with rising from sleep.

original: na kartā bhavati vijñānāṃ sabrahmacāriṇāṃ kāyena vaiyāpṛtyam /
analyzed: na kartā bhavati vijñānām sabrahmacāriṇām kāyena vaiyāpṛtyam
translated: He does not act with his body to assist his wise fellow monastics.

analyzed: evam pramāda kausīdya parigṛhītam bhavati
translated: In this way, he is seized by heedlessness and laziness.

analyzed: katham mithyā praṇihitam bhavati
translated: How is it wrongly applied?

analyzed: yathā api iha ekatyaḥ praṇidhāya brahmacaryam carati
translated: It is like this: someone here practices celibacy after making a vow.

original: anenāhaṃ śīlena vā vratena vā tapasā vā brahmacaryavāsena vā devo vā syāṃ devānyatamo vā /
analyzed: anena aham śīlena vā vratena vā tapasā vā brahmacarya vāsena vā devaḥ vā syām deva anyatamaḥ vā
translated: By this morality, or by this vow, or by this austerity, or by this dwelling in celibacy, may I become a god or one of the gods.

analyzed: lābha satkāra kāmaḥ bhavati  paratas lābha satkāram prārthayate
translated: He desires gain and honor.🔽He seeks gain and honor from others.

analyzed: lābha satkārasya spṛhayati
translated: He envies gain and honor.

analyzed: evam mithyā praṇihitam bhavati
translated: Thus it is wrongly applied.

analyzed: katham ācāra vipattyā parigṛhītam bhavati
translated: How is it taken up by failure in conduct?

original: yathāpīhaikatya īryāpathaṃ vādhiṣṭhāyetikaraṇīyaṃ vā kuśalapakṣaprayogaṃ vā lokotkrāntaś ca bhavati vinayotkrāntaś ca pūrvavad /
analyzed: yathā api iha ekatyaḥ īryāpatham vā adhiṣṭhāya itikaraṇīyam vā kuśala pakṣa prayogam vā loka utkrāntaḥ ca bhavati vinaya utkrāntaḥ ca pūrvavat
translated: It is like this: someone here, taking up a posture or a minor activity or an application to the side of virtue, becomes transcendent and vinaya-transcendent as before.

analyzed: evam ācāra vipattyā parigṛhītam bhavati
translated: Thus it is taken up by failure in conduct.

analyzed: katham ājīva vipattyā parigṛhītam bhavati
translated: How is it taken up by failure in livelihood?

original: yathāpīhaikatyo maheccho bhavaty asaṃtuṣṭo duṣpoṣo durbharajātīyaḥ /
analyzed: yathā api iha ekatyaḥ mahā icchaḥ bhavati a saṃtuṣṭaḥ duṣpoṣaḥ durbhara jātīyaḥ
translated: It is like this: someone here is greedy, discontented, difficult to support, of a kind that is difficult to maintain.

analyzed: sa ca adharmeṇa cīvaram
translated: And he seeks robes, etc.

analyzed: paryeṣate na dharmeṇa
translated: by unrighteous means, not by righteous means.

original: adharmeṇa piṇḍapātaṃ śayanāsanaṃ glānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkāraṃ paryeṣate na dharmeṇa /
analyzed: adharmeṇa piṇḍapātam śayana āsanam glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkāram paryeṣate na dharmeṇa
translated: He seeks alms, bedding and seats, and requisites for medicine when sick, by unrighteous means, not by righteous means.

original: sa ca cīvarapiṇḍapātaśayanāsanaglānapratyayabhaisajyapariṣkārahetor ātmano guṇasaṃbhāvanānimittam aprākṛtaṃ viṭhapitam īryāpathaṃ kalpayati /
analyzed: sa ca cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaisajya pariṣkāra hetoḥ ātmanaḥ guṇa saṃbhāvanā nimittam aprākṛtam viṭhapitam īryāpatham kalpayati
translated: And for the sake of robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and requisites for medicine when sick, he makes a counterfeit, artificial deportment, not natural, for the sake of being considered virtuous.

original: anuddhatendriyatām acapalendriyatāṃ śāntendriyatāṃ ca pareṣām upadarśayati /
analyzed: an uddhata indriya tām a capala indriya tām śānta indriya tām ca pareṣām upadarśayati
translated: He shows to others a state of faculties that are not agitated, faculties that are not restless, faculties that are calm.

original: yenāsya pare guṇasaṃbhāvanājñātā dātavyaṃ kartavyaṃ manyante /
analyzed: yena asya pare guṇa saṃbhāvanā jñātāḥ dātavyam kartavyam manyante
translated: By which others think that he should be given, that he should be served, because of his virtuous qualities.

analyzed: yat uta cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaisajya pariṣkārān
translated: Namely, robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and requisites for medicine when sick.

original: dhvāṅkṣaś ca bhavati mukharaḥ pragalbhaḥ kelāyitā nāmagotrodgṛhītā bahuśruto bhavati dharmadharaḥ /
analyzed: dhvāṅkṣaḥ ca bhavati mukharaḥ pragalbhaḥ kelāyitā nāma gotra udgṛhītā bahu śrutaḥ bhavati dharma dharaḥ
translated: And he becomes talkative, garrulous, a jester, one who recites names and lineages. He becomes learned, a bearer of the Dharma.

original: lābhakāraṇād eva ca pareṣāṃ dharmaṃ saṃlapati buddhabhāṣitaṃ vā śrāvakabhāṣitaṃ vā /
analyzed: lābha kāraṇāt eva ca pareṣām dharmam saṃlapati buddha bhāṣitam vā śrāvaka bhāṣitam vā
translated: And for the sake of gain alone, he speaks about the Dharma to others, whether spoken by the Buddha or a disciple.

original: ātmano vā guṇān bhūtān vā kiṃcid vā punaḥ samāropya svayam eva vaktā bhavati /
analyzed: ātmanaḥ vā guṇān bhūtān vā kiṃcid vā punar samāropya svayam eva vaktā bhavati
translated: Or he himself becomes a speaker, having exaggerated his own qualities, whether real or not, in some way.

analyzed: lāpayati vā paraiḥ
translated: Or he causes others to beg.

analyzed: anuttareṇa vā upadarśayitā
translated: Or he shows [his need] to the unsurpassed [donor].

analyzed: cīvara arthī vā
translated: Or he is in need of robes.

original: anyatamānyatamena vā śrāmaṇakena pariṣkāreṇārthī prabhūtena vāgratareṇa vā /
analyzed: anyatama anyatamena vā śrāmaṇakena pariṣkāreṇa arthī prabhūtena vā agratareṇa vā
translated: Or he is in need of any of the other requisites of a monastic, whether abundant, superior, or inferior.

analyzed: a vihanyamānaḥ pi prākṛtasya cīvarasya upadarśayitā bhavati
translated: Even if he is not suffering, he shows a common robe.

original: apy evarn śrāddhā brāhmaṇagṛhapatayaḥ cīvareṇa vighātaṃ saṃlakṣayitvā prabhūtaṃ praṇītaṃ cīvaraṃ dātavyaṃ kartavyaṃ maṃsyante /
analyzed: api evarn śrāddhāḥ brāhmaṇa gṛhapatayaḥ cīvareṇa vighātam saṃlakṣayitvā prabhūtam praṇītam cīvaram dātavyam kartavyam maṃsyante
translated: Thinking, 'Perhaps the faithful brahmins and householders, seeing my suffering regarding robes, will think to give abundant and excellent robes.'

original: yathā cīvaram evam anyatamānyatamaṃ śrāmaṇakaṃ jīvitapariṣkāram /
analyzed: yathā cīvaram evam anyatama anyatamam śrāmaṇakam jīvita pariṣkāram
translated: Just as with robes, so also with any of the other requisites of a monastic.

original: śrāddhānāṃ ca brāhmaṇagṛhapatīnām antikād yathākāmaṃ vālabhamānaḥ /
analyzed: śrāddhānām ca brāhmaṇa gṛhapatīnām antikāt yathākāmam vā ālabhamānaḥ
translated: Not obtaining from the faithful brahmins and householders as much as he desires,

original: asatsu vāsaṃvidyamāneṣu bhogeṣv alabhamāna evaṃ coparodhena yācate niṣpiṣya /
analyzed: asatsu vā a saṃvidyamāneṣu bhogeṣu a labhamānaḥ evam ca uparodhena yācate niṣpiṣya
translated: when the enjoyments are not present and he does not obtain [them], he begs in this way with obstruction, pressing [them].

analyzed: niṣpiṣya api ca enān paruṣayati api
translated: Even pressing [them], he also speaks harshly.

original: hīnaṃ vā punar labdhvā tathā saṃvidyamāneṣu bhogeṣu taṃ lābhaṃ paṃsayaty avasādayati /
analyzed: hīnam vā punar labdhvā tathā saṃvidyamāneṣu bhogeṣu tam lābham paṃsayati avasādayati
translated: Or having obtained something inferior, when the enjoyments are present, he criticizes and disparages that gain.

original: saṃmukhaṃ ca dātāraṃ dānapatim evaṃ cāha haṃ bho /🔽kulaputra /
analyzed: saṃmukham ca dātāram dānapatim evam ca āha haṃ bho  kula putra
translated: 'Sir,

original: santy eke kulaputrāḥ kuladuhitaraś ca ye tavāntikān nīcakulīnatarāś ca daridratarāś ca /
analyzed: santi eke kula putrāḥ kula duhitaraḥ ca ye tava antikāt nīca kulīnatarāḥ ca daridratarāḥ ca
translated: there are some sons and daughters of good family who are of lower birth and more poor than you.

original: te punar evaṃ caivaṃ ca praṇītadāyino manaāpadāyinaś ca /
analyzed: te punar evam ca evam ca praṇīta dāyinaḥ manaāpa dāyinaḥ ca
translated: But they are givers of excellent and pleasing gifts.

original: kasmāt tvaṃ teṣām antikād uccakulīnataraś cāḍhyataraś ca samāna evam amanāāpadāyī /🔽cāpraṇītaparīttadāyī ceti /🔽ya ebhir ākāraiḥ kuhanāṃ vā niśritya lapanāṃ vā naimittikatāṃ vā Śbh I
analyzed: kasmāt tvam teṣām antikāt ucca kulīnataraḥ ca āḍhyataraḥ ca samānaḥ evam a manāāpa dāyī  ca apraṇīta parītta dāyī ca iti  yaḥ ebhiḥ ākāraiḥ kuhanām vā niśritya lapanām vā naimittika tām vā
translated: Why are you, of higher birth and greater wealth, a giver of inferior and displeasing gifts?'

original: naiṣpeṣikatāṃ vā lābhena vā lābhaṃ niścikīrṣatāṃ cīvarapiṇḍapātaśayanāsanaglānapratyayabhaiṣajyapariṣkārān parataḥ paryeṣate /
analyzed: naiṣpeṣika tām vā lābhena vā lābham niścikīrṣatām cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaiṣajya pariṣkārān paratas paryeṣate
translated: Thus, relying on these forms of hypocrisy or flattery or hinting or seeking gain through gain, he seeks robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicine for the sick from others.

analyzed: saḥ dharmeṇa
translated: That is unrighteously.

original: yaḥ punar adharmeṇa so 'sya bhavati mithyājīvaḥ /
analyzed: yaḥ punar adharmeṇa saḥ sya bhavati mithyājīvaḥ
translated: And that unrighteously is his wrong livelihood.

original: evaṃ tac chīlam ājīvavipattyā parigṛhītaṃ bhavati //
analyzed: evam tat śīlam ājīva vipattyā parigṛhītam bhavati
translated: Thus that morality is embraced by the misfortune of livelihood.

analyzed: katham anta dvaya patitam bhavati
translated: How is it fallen into the two extremes?

analyzed: yathā api iha ekatyaḥ kāma sukhallika anuyuktaḥ bhavati adhyavasitaḥ
translated: It is like this: someone here is devoted to the pleasures of sense desire, is attached to them.

original: tān parataḥ pratilabdhān dharmeṇa vādharmeṇa vā cīvarapiṇḍapātaśayanāsanaglānapratyayabhaisajyapariṣkārān paribhuṅkte /
analyzed: tān paratas pratilabdhān dharmeṇa vā adharmeṇa vā cīvara piṇḍapāta śayana āsana glāna pratyaya bhaisajya pariṣkārān paribhuṅkte
translated: Having obtained them from others, he enjoys them by right or wrong means, such as robes, alms-food, bedding and seats, and medicine for the sick.

analyzed: ādīnava ādarśī niḥsaraṇam a prajānan
translated: Seeing danger in them, not knowing how to escape,

analyzed: ayam ucyate ekaḥ ntaḥ
translated: this is said to be one extreme.

original: punar aparam ihaikatya ātmaklamathānuyukto bhavaty anekaparyāyeṇātmānam ātāpayati saṃtāpayati kaṣṭavratasamādāyī ca bhavati /
analyzed: punar aparam iha ekatyaḥ ātma klamatha anuyuktaḥ bhavati aneka paryāyeṇa ātmānam ātāpayati saṃtāpayati kaṣṭa vrata samādāyī ca bhavati
translated: Moreover, here someone is devoted to self-mortification, in many ways he torments himself and is tormented, he undertakes difficult austerities.

original: tadyathā kaṇṭhakā pāśrayo vā bhavati bhasmāpāśrayo musalāpāśrayaḥ phalakāpāśrayo bhavati /🔽utkuṭukasthito bhavaty utkuṭukaprahāṇayogam anuyuktaḥ /
analyzed: tat yathā kaṇṭhaka apāśrayaḥ vā bhavati bhasma apāśrayaḥ musala apāśrayaḥ phalaka apāśrayaḥ bhavati  utkuṭuka sthitaḥ bhavati utkuṭuka prahāṇa yogam anuyuktaḥ
translated: For example, he is one who resorts to a stump, or one who resorts to a mat of grass, one who resorts to a mat of cow dung, one who resorts to a mat of chaff, one who resorts to a mat of leaves, one who resorts to a mat of pebbles, one who resorts to a mat of thorns, one who resorts to a mat of cow's hair, one who resorts to a mat of grain husks, one who resorts to a mat of wood shavings, one who resorts to a mat of ashes, one who resorts to a mat of earth, one who resorts to a mat of water, one who resorts to a mat of air, one who resorts to a mat of snow.

analyzed: agni paricārakaḥ bhavati
translated: He stands on one foot, he stands in the cross-legged position, he is devoted to the practice of standing in the cross-legged position.🔽He tends the sacrificial fire,

analyzed: yāvat tris api agnim paricarati
translated: up to he tends the sacrificial fire three times.

analyzed: udakam adhyārohaḥ bhavati
translated: He stands in water,

analyzed: yāvat tris api udakam adhyārohati
translated: up to he stands in water three times.

original: ekapādakaḥ sthitvā yataḥ sūryas tataḥ parivartate /
analyzed: eka pādakaḥ sthitvā yatas sūryaḥ tatas parivartate
translated: Standing on one foot, he turns to where the sun is.

original: iti yo vā punar apy evaṃbhāgīya ātmaklamathānuyogaḥ/
analyzed: iti yaḥ vā punar api evaṃbhāgīyaḥ ātma klamatha anuyogaḥ
translated: Or whatever else is of this kind, exertion in self-mortification.

analyzed: ayam ucyate dvitīyaḥ ntaḥ
translated: This is said to be the second extreme.

analyzed: evam anta dvaya patitam bhavati
translated: Thus it falls into the two extremes.

analyzed: katham a nairyāṇikam bhavati
translated: How does it become not leading to liberation?

original: yathāpīhaikatyaḥ śīlaṃ vā vrataṃ vā dṛṣṭyā parāmṛśati /
analyzed: yathā api iha ekatyaḥ śīlam vā vratam vā dṛṣṭyā parāmṛśati
translated: For example, here someone clings to a view about morality or asceticism,

original: anenaiva śīlena vā vratena vā śuddhir bhaviṣyati /
analyzed: anena eva śīlena vā vratena vā śuddhiḥ bhaviṣyati
translated: thinking, By this morality or asceticism alone, there will be purity,

analyzed: muktiḥ niryāṇam bhaviṣyati iti
translated: there will be liberation, there will be escape.

original: sarvaṃ ca śīlam ito bāhyānāṃ surakṣitam api suviśuddham api tad upamayā viśuddhyānairyāṇikam ity ucyate /
analyzed: sarvam ca śīlam itas bāhyānām su rakṣitam api su viśuddham api tat upamayā viśuddhyā anairyāṇikam iti ucyate
translated: And all morality, even if well-guarded and well-purified by outsiders, is said to be not leading to liberation by analogy with purity.

analyzed: evam anairyāṇikam bhavati  śbh i
translated: Thus it becomes not leading to liberation.

analyzed: katham samādāna paribhraṣṭam bhavati
translated: How does it become fallen away from undertaking?

original: yathāpīhaikatyaḥ sarveṇa sarvam alajjī bhavati nirapekṣaḥ śrāmaṇye /
analyzed: yathā api iha ekatyaḥ sarveṇa sarvam alajjī bhavati nirapekṣaḥ śrāmaṇye
translated: For example, here someone is completely and totally shameless, indifferent to the spiritual life,

original: sa ca bhavati duḥśīlaḥ pāpadharmā antaḥpūtir avasrutaḥ kaśambakajātaḥ śaṃkhasvarasamācāraḥ /
analyzed: sa ca bhavati duḥśīlaḥ pāpa dharmā antar pūtiḥ avasrutaḥ kaśambaka jātaḥ śaṃkha svara samācāraḥ
translated: and he is immoral, of evil character, rotten within, oozing, a cheat, acting like a conch.

analyzed: aśramaṇaḥ śramaṇa pratijñaḥ
translated: He is not an ascetic, but pretends to be an ascetic.

analyzed: abrahmacārī brahmacāri pratijñaḥ evam samādāna paribhraṣṭam bhavati
translated: One who is not celibate but pretends to be celibate, in this way, violates the undertaking.

original: ebhir daśabhiḥ kāraṇair vipannaṃ śīlaṃ śīlavipattir ity uktā bhagavatā /
analyzed: ebhiḥ daśabhiḥ kāraṇaiḥ vipannam śīlam śīla vipattiḥ iti uktā bhagavatā
translated: The Blessed One has said that morality that is ruined by these ten causes is called a downfall of morality.

original: api ca śīlavyasanam apy uktaṃ bhagavatā /
analyzed: api ca śīla vyasanam api uktam bhagavatā
translated: Moreover, the Blessed One has also spoken of a misfortune of morality.

original: tac caibhyaḥ kāraṇebhyo dvābhyāṃ kāraṇābhyāṃ veditavyaṃ /
analyzed: tat ca ebhyaḥ kāraṇebhyaḥ dvābhyām kāraṇābhyām veditavyam
translated: And that should be known as twofold:

analyzed: yā ca anairyāṇika tā yaḥ ca samādāna bhraṃśaḥ
translated: that which does not lead to liberation and that which is a downfall of the undertaking.

original: tadanyaiś ca kāraṇaiḥ śīlavipattir eva veditavyā //🔽Śbh I
analyzed: tad anyaiḥ ca kāraṇaiḥ śīla vipattiḥ eva veditavyā  śbh i
translated: The other causes should be known as a downfall of morality.

original: eṣām eva ca kṛṣṇapaksavyavasthitānāṃ kāraṇānāṃ viparyayeṇa śuklapakṣyaiḥ kāraṇaiḥ śīlasaṃpattir veditavyā śīlaviśuddhiś ca //
analyzed: eṣām eva ca kṛṣṇapaksa vyavasthitānām kāraṇānām viparyayeṇa śukla pakṣyaiḥ kāraṇaiḥ śīla saṃpattiḥ veditavyā śīla viśuddhiḥ ca
translated: The perfection of morality and the purity of morality should be known by the causes on the bright side, which are the opposites of these causes on the dark side.

original: kvacit punar bhagavatā śīlaṃ mūlārthenoktam / yathoktam /
analyzed: kvacid punar bhagavatā śīlam mūla arthena uktam yathā uktam
translated: Moreover, in some places the Blessed One has spoken of morality in the sense of a root, as it is said:

analyzed: su pratiṣṭhita mūlaḥ syāt cittasya upaśame rataḥ
translated: One should have well-established roots, delight in the pacification of mind,

original: saṃyukto ca visaṃyukto dṛṣṭyādṛṣṭyāryapāpayā // iti gāthā //
analyzed: ca visaṃyuktaḥ dṛṣṭyā adṛṣṭyā ārya pāpayā iti gāthā
translated: Be endowed and not endowed, with right and wrong views.

analyzed: kvacid alaṃkāra śabdena uktam
translated: In some places it is spoken of by the word ornament,

analyzed: yathā uktam
translated: as it is said:🔽The one who is endowed with morality, even if he is poor, is not poor.

analyzed: śīla alaṃkāra saṃpannaḥ bhikṣuḥ vā bhikṣuṇī vā
translated: A monk or nun who is endowed with the ornament of morality.

analyzed: akuśalam prajahāti kuśalam bhāvayati
translated: One abandons the unwholesome and cultivates the wholesome.

analyzed: kvacid anulepana śabdena uktam
translated: In some places it is called ointment.

analyzed: yatra āha
translated: Where it is said:

original: śīlānulepanasaṃpanno bhikṣur vā bhikṣuṇī veti pūrvavat /
analyzed: śīla anulepana saṃpannaḥ bhikṣuḥ vā bhikṣuṇī vā iti pūrvavat
translated: A monk or nun who is endowed with the ointment of morality, as before.

analyzed: kvacid gandha śabdena uktam
translated: In some places it is called fragrance.

original: asti tad ānanda gandhajātam yasyānuvātam api gandho vāti /
analyzed: asti tat ānanda gandha jātam yasya anuvātam api gandhaḥ vāti
translated: Ānanda, there is that kind of fragrant substance whose fragrance blows with the wind,

analyzed: prativātam api
translated: and also against the wind,

original: anuvātam api prativātam api gandho vāti /
analyzed: anuvātam api prativātam api gandhaḥ vāti
translated: and whose fragrance blows both with and against the wind.

analyzed: kvacid su carita śabdena uktam
translated: In some places it is called good conduct.

analyzed: yatra āha
translated: Where it is said:

original: kāyasucaritasyeṣṭo vipāko dṛṣṭe dharme 'bhisaṃparāye ca evaṃ vāksucaritasya /
analyzed: kāya su caritasya iṣṭaḥ vipākaḥ dṛṣṭe dharme bhisaṃparāye ca evam vāc su caritasya
translated: The desirable result of good bodily conduct is experienced in this life and in future lives, and so is the result of good verbal conduct.

analyzed: kvacid saṃvara śabdena uktam
translated: In some places it is called restraint.

analyzed: yatra āha
translated: Where it is said:

analyzed: dātā dānapatiḥ śīlavān bhavati
translated: A giver, a lord of giving, becomes moral.

analyzed: saṃvara sthāyī āgama dṛṣṭiḥ phala darśī
translated: Dwelling in restraint, seeing the scriptures, seeing the result.

analyzed: api ca uktam śīlavān viharati
translated: Moreover, it is said: One dwells morally.

analyzed: prātimokṣa saṃvara saṃvṛtaḥ iti vistaraḥ
translated: Dwelling in the restraint of individual liberation, in detail.

original: kena kāraṇena bhagavatā śīlaṃ mūlaśabdenoktaṃ pratiṣṭhārthādhārārtho mūlārthaḥ /

original: tac caitac chīlaṃ sarveṣām eva laukikalokottarāṇāṃ guṇānām anavadyānām agryānāṃ pravarānām sukhāhārāṇāṃ /

translated: And that morality is the foundation for all worldly and transcendent qualities, which are irreproachable, foremost, excellent, and conducive to happiness.

analyzed: pratiṣṭhā sthānīyam śbh i
translated: It is the basis for their origination.

analyzed: ca utpattaye pratilaṃbhāya tasmāt mūla śabdena ucyate
translated: Therefore, it is called the root.

original: tadyathā pṛthivī pratiṣṭhā bhavaty ādhāras tṛṇagulmauṣadhivanaspatīnām utpattaye /
analyzed: tat yathā pṛthivī pratiṣṭhā bhavati ādhāraḥ tṛṇa gulma oṣadhi vanaspatīnām utpattaye
translated: Just as the earth is the foundation and support for the origination of grass, bushes, herbs, and trees,

original: evam eva śīlaṃ vistareṇa pūrvavad vācyam //
analyzed: evam eva śīlam vistareṇa pūrvavat vācyam
translated: in the same way, morality should be spoken of in detail as before.

analyzed: kena kāraṇena śīlam alaṃkāra śabdena khyātām

translated: Those other ornaments, such as necklaces,🔽bracelets,

analyzed: keyūrāḥ vā  mudrikā vā
translated: armlets,🔽signet rings,

analyzed: jātarūpa rajata mālāḥ vā
translated: and gold and silver garlands,

original: tāni yāvād ayaṃ dahro bhavati śiśuḥ kṛṣṇakeśaḥ pratyagrayauvanasamanvāgataḥ tāvad asya vibhūṣaṇāni prāvṛtāni śobhāmātrāṃ janayanti /
analyzed: tāni yāvāt ayam dahraḥ bhavati śiśuḥ kṛṣṇa keśaḥ pratyagra yauvana samanvāgataḥ tāvat asya vibhūṣaṇāni prāvṛtāni śobhā mātrām janayanti
translated: as long as this person is young, a child with black hair, endowed with fresh youth, as long as those ornaments, when worn, generate mere beauty,

analyzed: na tu evam punar jīrṇasya
translated: but not so for one who is old,

analyzed: vṛddhasya
translated: advanced in age,

analyzed: vā
translated: eighty years old,

analyzed: nāvatikasya vā  khaṇḍa dantasya
translated: or ninety years old,🔽with broken teeth,

analyzed: palita śirasaḥ
translated: and gray hair.

original: nānyatra tair vibhūṣaṇaiḥ prāvṛtaiḥ sa viḍambita iva khyāti /
analyzed: na anyatra taiḥ vibhūṣaṇaiḥ prāvṛtaiḥ sa viḍambitaḥ iva khyāti
translated: He is not so well known when he is adorned with those ornaments.

analyzed: ārogya vyasane vā
translated: Or when there is a misfortune of health.

analyzed: bhoga vyasane vā
translated: Or when there is a misfortune of wealth.

analyzed: jñāti vyasane vā pratyupasthite na śobhate
translated: Or when a misfortune of relatives has befallen, he does not shine.

original: śīlaṃ punaḥ sarveṣāṃ sarvakālaṃ ca śobhākaraṃ bhavati /
analyzed: śīlam punar sarveṣām sarvakālam ca śobhā karam bhavati
translated: But morality always makes one shine in all circumstances.

analyzed: tasmāt alaṃkāra śabdena ucyate
translated: Therefore, it is called an ornament.

analyzed: kena kāraṇena śīlam anulepana śabdena uktam
translated: By what reason is morality said to be an ointment?

original: tat khalu kuśalam anavadyaṃ śīlasamādānaṃ sarvadauḥśīlyasamādānahetukaṃ kāyaparidāhaṃ cittaparidāham apanayati /
analyzed: tat khalu kuśalam anavadyam śīla samādānam sarva dauḥśīlya samādāna hetukam kāya paridāham citta paridāham apanayati
translated: That good, blameless undertaking of morality removes the burning of the body and the burning of the mind caused by all the causes for undertaking bad conduct.

analyzed: anena kāraṇena śīlam anulepana śabdena ucyate
translated: For this reason, morality is said to be an ointment.

analyzed: kena kāraṇena śīlam gandha jāta śabdena ucyate
translated: By what reason is morality said to be a kind of fragrance?

original: śīlavataḥ khalu puruṣapudgalasya digvidikṣu kalyāṇaḥ kīrtiyaśaḥśabdaśloko niścarati /
analyzed: śīlavataḥ khalu puruṣa pudgalasya diś vidikṣu kalyāṇaḥ kīrti yaśaḥ śabda ślokaḥ niścarati
translated: For a person who has morality, good fame, renown, sound, and praise go out in all directions.🔽of various kinds...

analyzed: vividhānām śbh i
translated: of various kinds

analyzed: vā mūla gandha jātānām sāra gandha jātānām vā
translated: Or of root-smelling things, or of essence-smelling things,

original: puṣpagandhānāṃ vā vāteritānāṃ digvidikṣu manaāpo gandho niścarati /
analyzed: puṣpa gandhānām vā vāta īritānām diś vidikṣu manaāpaḥ gandhaḥ niścarati

analyzed: anena kāraṇena śīlam gandha jāta śabdena ucyate

analyzed: kena kāraṇena śīlam su carita śabdena ucyate
translated: For what reason is morality called good conduct?

analyzed: sukha gāminī eṣā caryā svarga gāminī sugati gāminī
translated: This conduct leads to happiness, to heaven, to good destinies.

original: eṣā caryā tasmāt sucaritam ity ucyate //
analyzed: eṣā caryā tasmāt su caritam iti ucyate
translated: This conduct is called good conduct.

analyzed: kena kāraṇena śīlam saṃvara śabdena ucyate
translated: For what reason is morality called restraint?

analyzed: nivṛtti svabhāvaḥ eṣa dharmaḥ nivṛtti lakṣaṇaḥ virati svabhāvaḥ
translated: This dharma has the nature of cessation, the characteristic of cessation, the nature of abstinence.

analyzed: tasmāt saṃvara śabdena ucyate
translated: Therefore, it is called by the word restraint.

original: asya punaḥ śīlasaṃvarasya trividhā pratyavekṣā pariśuddhinimittam /
analyzed: asya punar śīla saṃvarasya trividhā pratyavekṣā pariśuddhi nimittam

analyzed: katamā trividhā
translated: What are the three?

analyzed: yat uta kāya karma pratyavekṣā
translated: Namely, investigation of bodily action,

analyzed: vāc karma pratyavekṣā
translated: investigation of verbal action,

analyzed: manaskarma pratyavekṣā

analyzed: katham etāni karmāṇi pratyavekṣamāṇaḥ śīla saṃvaram pariśodhayati

analyzed: saced saḥ evam pratyavekṣamāṇaḥ jānāti

analyzed: na karoti na anuprayacchati

analyzed: yathā kāya karma evam vāc karma veditavyam  atītān saṃskārān pratītya utpadyate manaḥ

analyzed: tena eva prīti prāmodyena ahar rātra anuśikṣī bahulam viharati iyam ucyate pariśodhanā

analyzed: tatra evam pariśuddhasya śīla saṃvarasya daśā anuśaṃsāḥ veditavyāḥ
translated: Among them, the ten benefits of the pure moral discipline should be known in this way.

analyzed: katame daśa
translated: What are the ten?

original: iha śīlavān puruṣapudgalaḥ śīlaviśuddhim ātmanaḥ pratyavekṣamāṇo 'vipratisāraṃ protilabhate /
analyzed: iha śīlavān puruṣa pudgalaḥ śīla viśuddhim ātmanaḥ pratyavekṣamāṇaḥ vipratisāram protilabhate
translated: Here, a virtuous person, a person of character, examining his own purity of moral discipline, obtains non-remorse.

analyzed: a vipratisāriṇaḥ prāmodyam pramudita cittasya prītiḥ jāyate
translated: For one without remorse, joy arises. For one whose mind is joyful, delight is born.

analyzed: prīta manasaḥ kāyaḥ praśrabhyate
translated: For one whose mind is delighted, the body becomes tranquil.

analyzed: sa praśrabdha kāyaḥ sukham vedayate
translated: He, with a tranquil body, experiences pleasure.

original: sukhitasya cittaṃ samādhīyate samāhitacitto yathābhūtaṃ prajānāti /
analyzed: sukhitasya cittam samādhīyate samāhita cittaḥ yathābhūtam prajānāti
translated: For one who is happy, the mind becomes concentrated. For one whose mind is concentrated, one knows as it really is.

analyzed: yathābhūtam paśyati
translated: One sees as it really is.

original: yathābhūtaṃ jānan paśyan nirvidyate nirviṇṇo virajyate /
analyzed: yathābhūtam jānan paśyan nirvidyate nirviṇṇaḥ virajyate
translated: Knowing and seeing as it really is, one becomes disgusted. The disgusted one becomes detached.

analyzed: viraktaḥ vimucyate
translated: The detached one is liberated.

analyzed: vimuktasya vimuktaḥ smi iti jñāna darśanam bhavati
translated: For one who is liberated, there is the knowledge and vision that 'I am liberated.'

analyzed: yāvat nirupadhi śeṣe nirvāṇa dhātau parinirvāti
translated: Up to: one attains final nirvāṇa in the nirvāṇa element without remainder.

original: yac chīlavān puruṣapudgalaḥ śīlaviśuddhyadhipateyam avipratisāraṃ pratilabhate /
analyzed: yat śīlavān puruṣa pudgalaḥ śīla viśuddhi ādhipateyam a vipratisāram pratilabhate
translated: A virtuous person, a person-individual, obtains non-remorsefulness that is governed by the purity of morality.

original: anupūrveṇa yāvan nirvāṇagamanāyāyaṃ prathamaḥ śīlānuśaṃsaḥ //🔽Śbh I
analyzed: anupūrveṇa yāvat nirvāṇa gamanāya ayam prathamaḥ śīla anuśaṃsaḥ  śbh i
translated: In due order, up to going to nirvāṇa. This is the first benefit of morality.

original: punar aparaṃ śīlavān puruṣapudglaḥ maraṇakālasamaye pratyupasthite /
analyzed: punar aparam śīlavān puruṣa pudglaḥ maraṇa kāla samaye pratyupasthite
translated: Moreover, a virtuous person, a person-individual, when the time of death has arrived,

original: kṛtaṃ bata me sukṛtaṃ kāyena vācā manasā /
analyzed: kṛtam bata me su kṛtam kāyena vācā manasā
translated: thinks: 'Indeed, I have done good deeds with body, speech, and mind.

original: na kṛtaṃ bata me duścaritaṃ kāyena pūrvavat iti yā gatiḥ kṛtapuṇyānāṃ kṛtakuśalānām kṛtabhayabhīrutrāṇānāṃ tāṃ gatiṃ pretya /
analyzed: na kṛtam bata me duścaritam kāyena pūrvavat iti yā gatiḥ kṛta puṇyānām kṛta kuśalānām kṛta bhaya bhīru trāṇānām tām gatim pretya
translated: Indeed, I have not done bad deeds with body, as before.' He thinks: 'After death, I will go to the destination of those who have done meritorious deeds, who have done wholesome deeds, who have done deeds that protect from fear.'

analyzed: gamiṣyāmi iti dvitīyam a vipratisāram pratilabhate sugati gamanāya
translated: He obtains the second non-remorsefulness for going to a good destination.

original: avipratisāriṇo hi puruṣapudgalasya bhadrakaṃ maranaṃ bhavati bhadrikā kālakriyā bhadrako 'bhisaṃparāyaḥ /
analyzed: a vipratisāriṇaḥ hi puruṣa pudgalasya bhadrakam maranam bhavati bhadrikā kālakriyā bhadrakaḥ bhisaṃparāyaḥ
translated: For a person-individual who is non-remorseful, death is good, the end of life is good, the next world is good.

analyzed: ayam dvitīyaḥ śīla anuśaṃsaḥ
translated: This is the second benefit of morality.

original: punar aparaṃ śīlavataḥ puruṣapudgalasya digvidikṣu kalyāṇo varṇakīrtiyaśaśabdaśloko niścarati /
analyzed: punar aparam śīlavataḥ puruṣa pudgalasya diś vidikṣu kalyāṇaḥ varṇa kīrti yaśa śabda ślokaḥ niścarati
translated: Furthermore, for a virtuous person, a good reputation, fame, praise, and renown spread in all directions.

analyzed: ayam tṛtīyaḥ śīla anuśaṃsaḥ
translated: This is the third benefit of morality.

original: yathāpi tad rājñaḥ pauruṣeyā āvarodhikāni nagarāṇy anupraskandataḥ taptenāpi tailenāvasicyante /🔽taptayā vasayā /
analyzed: yathā api tat rājñaḥ pauruṣeyāḥ āvarodhikāni nagarāṇi anupraskandataḥ taptena api tailena avasicyante  taptayā vasayā

analyzed: taptayā gomaya loḍikayā  taptena tāmreṇa

analyzed: taptena ayasā

original: iṣubhiḥ śaktibhiś cāpakṛttagātrā maraṇaṃ vā nigacchanti maraṇamātrakaṃ vā duḥkham /
analyzed: iṣubhiḥ śaktibhiḥ ca apakṛtta gātrāḥ maraṇam vā nigacchanti maraṇa mātrakam vā duḥkham

analyzed: ayam ucyate svātantrya kṛtaḥ ādīnavaḥ iti yaḥ vā punar evaṃbhāgīyaḥ

analyzed: tatra katamaḥ duścarita kṛtaḥ ādīnavaḥ
translated: Herein, what is the danger arising from misconduct?

original: yathāpi tad ekatyenāhāranidānaṃ prabhūtaṃ kāyena duścaritaṃ kṛtaṃ bhavaty upacitaṃ /
analyzed: yathā api tat ekatyena āhāra nidānam prabhūtam kāyena duścaritam kṛtam bhavati upacitam

analyzed: yathā kāyena evam vācā manasā sa ca yasmin samaye ābādhikaḥ bhavati  duḥkhitaḥ

analyzed: bādha glānaḥ
translated: afflicted, and weak,

analyzed: tasya tat pūrvakam kāya duścaritam vāc manaḥ duścaritam
translated: that previous misconduct of body, speech, and mind

analyzed: parvatānām vā parvata kūṭānām vā
translated: of the mountains or mountain peaks,

analyzed: sāyāhne yat chāyā avalambate dhī avalambate bhipralambate
translated: in the evening, the shadow leans, leans upon, hangs over

analyzed: tasya evam bhavati
translated: He thinks like this:

original: kṛtaṃ bata me pāpaṃ na kṛtaṃ bata me puṇyaṃ kāyena vācā manasā /
analyzed: kṛtam bata me pāpam na kṛtam bata me puṇyam kāyena vācā manasā
translated: Alas, I have done evil, I have not done merit, with body, speech, or mind.

original: so 'haṃ yā gatiḥ kṛtapāpānāṃ gatiṃ pretya gamiṣyāmīti vipratisārī kālaṃ karoti kālaṃ ca kṛtvā 'pāyeṣūpapadyate yaduta narakeṣu tiryakpreteṣu
analyzed: sā u ham yā gatiḥ kṛta pāpānām gatim pretya gamiṣyāmi iti vipratisārī kālam karoti kālam ca kṛtvā pāyeṣu upapadyate yat uta narakeṣu tiryak preteṣu
translated: I will go to the realm of those who have done evil after death. Repenting, he dies. And after death, he is reborn in the lower realms, namely in the hells, as an animal, or as a hungry ghost.

analyzed: ayam ucyate duścarita kṛtaḥ ādīnavaḥ
translated: This is called the danger of having done misconduct.

original: tasyaivaṃ bhavati /🔽ity ayam āhāraḥ paryeṣyamāṇo 'pi sādīnavaḥ /
analyzed: tasya evam bhavati  iti ayam āhāraḥ paryeṣyamāṇaḥ sa ādīnavaḥ

analyzed: paribhujyamānaḥ pi sa ādīnavaḥ

analyzed: paribhuktaḥ pi pariṇāmaḥ ādīnavaḥ
translated: Even when enjoyed, the transformation is a disadvantage.

original: evam asti punar asyāhārasya kācid anuśaṃsamātrā /
analyzed: evam asti punar asya āhārasya kācid anuśaṃsa mātrā

analyzed: sā punar katamā

analyzed: āhārasthitikaḥ yam kāyaḥ āhāram niśritya tiṣṭhati
translated: This body is sustained by food. It remains dependent on food.

analyzed: na an āharaḥ
translated: It is not without food.

analyzed: iyam api ānuśaṃsa mātrā
translated: This is also a benefit.

original: Śbh I evam asyāhārasthitiko 'yaṃ kāyḥ suciram api tiṣṭhañ ca varṣaśataṃ vā tiṣṭhati /
analyzed: evam asya āhāra sthitikaḥ yam kāyaḥ su ciram api ca varṣa śatam vā tiṣṭhati
translated: Thus, this body, which is sustained by food, even if it remains for a long time, remains for a hundred years,

original: kiṃcid vā punar bhūyaḥ samyak parihriyamāṇaḥ /
analyzed: kiṃcid vā punar bhūyas samyak parihriyamāṇaḥ

original: asti cāsyārvāg uparatiḥ /🔽tatra ye kāyasthitimātre pratipannāḥ na te supratipannāḥ /

analyzed: ye kāya sthiti mātrakeṇa saṃtuṣṭāḥ na ca te su saṃtuṣṭā

analyzed: ye punar na kāya sthiti mātrakeṇa saṃtuṣṭāḥ
translated: But those who are not content only with maintaining the body,

analyzed: na kāya sthiti mātrake pratipannāḥ
translated: and are not devoted only to maintaining the body,

analyzed: api tu tām eva kāyasthitim niśritya brahmacaryam samudāgamāya pratipannāḥ
translated: but rather, relying on that very maintenance of the body, are devoted to attaining the holy life,

analyzed: te su pratipannāḥ
translated: they are well devoted.

translated: And they experience the complete and irreproachable benefits.🔽It would not be fitting for me to be satisfied and dwell with just the minimal benefits of food.

analyzed: tasya evam bhavati

analyzed: prapīḍya prapīḍya tvak māṃsa śoṇitam asmākam anuprayacchanti
translated: having squeezed their skin, flesh, and blood, give it to us.

original: yadutānukampām upādāya viśeṣaphalārthinas tasyāsmākaṃ tathā pratilabdhasya piṇḍapātasyāyam evaṃrūpo 'nurūpaḥ paribhogaḥ syāt /

translated: Namely, out of compassion, for those who seek special fruits, may this be the proper enjoyment of the alms that we have thus obtained.

analyzed: yat aham tathā
translated: As I, thus

analyzed: paribhūtam ātmānam sthāpayitvā paribhuñjīya

analyzed: anātma utkarsī
